duration_in_months: There is no bid validaion available
full_summary:
=====

### General Information
#### Notice Title 
E60HL-23K201-A Request for Proposal for Bulk Coloured Diesel Fuel
*French version: E60HL-23K201-A Demande de propositions pour le carburant diesel coloré en vrac*

### References
*Reference Number:* WS3939445800-Doc3941225762
*Amendment Number:* 1
*Solicitation Number:* WS3939445800

### Notice Details
#### Publication Date
The notice was published on March 29, 2023.
#### Tender Closing Date
All tender submissions must reach the contracting authority by May 9, 2023 at 14:00:00.
#### Amendment Date
The amendment was issued on March 30, 2023.

### Tender Description
Bulk Coloured Diesel Fuel in accordance with CAN/CGSB 3.517-2020 (latest issue), Type A (P-50) specifications shall be delivered on a DDP (Delivered Duty Paid) basis to the Port of Quebec City, Quebec.

The total quantity of fuel to be delivered is 865,000 litres, as follows: 
* 750,000 litres (Item 1)
* 115,000 litres (Item 2)

The fuel shall be loaded onto a Canadian Coast Guard vessel, CCGS Pierre Radisson, for furtherance to Eureka, Nunavut. The tentative delivery dates are June 3rd and 4th, 2023.

### Assumptions and Considerations
It is expected that deliveries to Eureka, Nunavut will be subject to the Nunavut Land Claim Agreement (NLCA). 

### Evaluation Criteria
Proposals will be evaluated against the selection criteria of Lowest Price.

### Trade Agreements
This tender is subject to the terms and conditions of the following trade agreements: Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canadian Free Trade Agreement, Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, and World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement.

### Contact Information
For questions and concerns, please contact: MacLeod, Bobbi (SPAC/PSPC) at bobbi.macleod@tpsgc-pwgsc
